body: Yes, edges hold only an **input_nr**, never an output_nr. It's just that when you take `gradient_edge()` outputs become reversed with inputs, so we set the `input_nr` of the edge to equal to the `output_nr` of the Variable.
body_html: Yes, edges hold only an input_nr, never an output_nr. It's just that when you take gradient_edge() outputs become reversed with inputs, so we set the input_nr of the edge to equal to the output_nr of the Variable.
body_text: Yes, edges hold only an input_nr, never an output_nr. It's just that when you take gradient_edge() outputs become reversed with inputs, so we set the input_nr of the edge to equal to the output_nr of the Variable.
